content:
Configure Data to Populate Employer Contribution in Policy Records

Store employer contribution percentages and amounts in the policies created by the enrollment process.

Create group class records for a given Account using entity layouts.
Create group class contribution records for the group classes.

When multiple group class contribution records are created, the enrollment flow uses the record updated most recently to calculate premiums.

Link each Group Class Contribution to a Contract Group Plan, Product, or Group Benefits Product Category in the Contract Group Plan Group Class object.

If all three values are provided, the Contract Group Plan is used for calculating the employer contribution amount. If only Product and Group Benefits Product Category values are provided, then Product is considered for calculation.

Learn About Group Classes and Group Class Contributions

Group classes are groups of members who receive similar benefits. Examples include Executives, Managers, and Directors. Group class contributions have details about the benefits provided by the employer for a group class.

Fetch Group Class Contribution Records for Premium Calculation

During enrollment, fetch all valid group class contribution records for the group class associated with each member.
title: Configuring Employer Contributions in Insurance Policy Records
